Detailed Description

This class implements the Mixture Model unsupervised learning.

Children classes have to implement the pure virtual functions get_initialization_cluster() and create_cluster_learn_object().

It uses the EM learning algorithm and is based on the plEMLearner class.

See Also
plLearnGMM

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum plLearnMixtureModel::OptimalityCriterion

Type for optimality score allowing to choose the best number of components (clusters).

See Also
set_optimality_score()
Enumerator
AIC 

Akaike's Information Criterion.

BIC 

Bayesian Information Criterion.

[in]ObsVarsThe variables on which the mixture model will be learned
[in]n_mixtureThe number of components (kernels) of the mixture
plLearnMixtureModel::plLearnMixtureModel ( const plVariablesConjunction &  ObsVars,
const std::vector< size_t > &  n_mixture_candidates 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
[in]ObsVarsThe variables on which the mixture model will be learned
[in]n_mixture_candidatesThe candidate number of components (kernels) of the mixture. Choosing among this candidates will be based on the optimality score (as defined by set_optimality_score() among BIC, AIC, ...)

virtual unsigned int plLearnMixtureModel::get_n_parameters ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.

virtual void plLearnMixtureModel::get_parameters ( plValues &  params) const
virtual

Returns all learnt parameters of the object (parameters passed to the distribution constructors when calling 'get_distribution').

This virtual method has to be implemented in all derived classes.

Implements plNonCndLearnObject.
